snippet: Vladimir I. Yakunin was seen as wielding vast power through the rail monopoly, and a relatively unknown technocrat was appointed to the post.
abstract: Vladimir I Yakunin, longtime personal associate of Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin, resigns as head of state rail company and is replaced by prime minister appointee Oleg Belozyorov, deputy minister of transportation; resignation indicates shake-up in country’s political inner circle.
lead_paragraph: Vladimir I. Yakunin was seen as wielding vast power through the rail monopoly, and a relatively unknown technocrat was appointed to the post.

headline.main: Head of Russian Railways, Close to Putin, Resigns
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Russia: Head of Rail Company Resigns
